channel.title: Reuters: World News
channel.description: Reuters.com is your source for breaking news, business, financial and investing news, including personal finance and stocks. Reuters is the leading global provider of news, financial information and technology solutions to the world's media, financial institutions, businesses and individuals.
channel.copyright: All rights reserved. Users may download and print extracts of content from this website for their own personal and non-commercial use only. item.title: Two Kenyans with Iran links arrested for plotting attacks: ministry
item.description: NAIROBI (Reuters) - Kenyan security forces have arrested two Kenyan men with links to Iran on suspicion of planning attacks in the East African nation, the Interior Ministry said on Saturday.

item.title: Top Kurdish lawyer killed in southeast Turkey, protests expected
item.description: DIYARBAKIR, Turkey/ANKARA (Reuters) - An unidentified gunman killed a prominent Kurdish lawyer and rights activist on Saturday in what the pro-Kurdish HDP Party called a "planned assassination", urging people to take to the streets in protest.

item.title: Turkey's Erdogan sees Paris climate summit as chance to mend ties with Russia
item.description: ISTANBUL (Reuters) - Turkish President Tayyip Erdogan said on Saturday the climate change summit in Paris next week could be a chance to repair relations with Moscow after Turkey shot down a Russian jet near the Syrian border on Tuesday.

item.title: Suicide car bomb kills five in northern Iraq
item.description: BAGHDAD (Reuters) - At least five people were killed in a suicide car bomb attack in a northern Iraqi town which has recently witnessed deadly clashes between Kurdish and Shi'ite paramilitary forces, the mayor and security sources said on Saturday.

item.title: Police, migrants clash on Macedonia border; soldiers build fence
item.description: IDOMENI, Greece (Reuters) - Police in Macedonia fired tear gas and stun grenades at desperate migrants stranded for days at the Greek border and who are demanding passage to western Europe, as soldiers began erecting a metal fence to keep them out.

item.title: Spain's Rajoy vows to cut tax, create jobs if re-elected
item.description: MADRID (Reuters) - Spain's ruling party will cut income tax and create two million jobs over the next four years if re-elected next month, center-right Prime Minister Mariano Rajoy told a campaign rally on Saturday.

item.title: Ahead of climate summit, French use emergency laws to put activists under house arrest
item.description: STRASBOURG, France (Reuters) - France has put 24 green activists under house arrest ahead of the United Nations climate talks, using emergency laws put in place following the Paris shootings, Interior Minister Bernard Cazeneuve said on Saturday.

item.title: China police bust online gun ring, seize 1,180 guns: Xinhua
item.description: SHANGHAI (Reuters) - Police in China, where gun possession by ordinary people is illegal, have busted an online gun selling operation, seizing 1,180 guns and more than 6 million bullets, the state news agency Xinhua reported on Saturday.

item.title: Police fire tear gas on crowd of mourners in eastern Congo
item.description: KINSHASA (Reuters) - Congolese police fired tear gas to disperse hundreds of people who had gathered in the eastern city of Goma on Saturday to pay tribute to victims of recurrent attacks nearby, organizers said.

item.title: Syrian army advances against Islamic State east of Aleppo: Syria state TV
item.description: BEIRUT (Reuters) - The Syrian army captured territory from Islamic State east of Aleppo including several kilometers (miles) of highway linking the city with the jihadists' de facto capital of Raqqa, Syrian state TV reported on Saturday.

item.title: Morocco arrests Turks suspected of Islamic State links
item.description: RABAT (Reuters) - Moroccan police have arrested three people on suspicion of hacking telecommunications equipment, including two Turkish nationals who are suspected of having ties to Islamic State, the Interior Ministry said.

item.title: Suspected jihadists kill three at U.N. base in north Mali
item.description: BAMAKO (Reuters) - The United Nations said unknown attackers fired rockets at a U.N. peacekeeping base in Kidal in northern Mali on Saturday, killing three people inside, in the latest sign that the West African country's Islamist insurgency is intensifying.

item.title: Gaffer tape and 500 euros: running guns to the heart of Europe
item.description: BELGRADE/BRUSSELS (Reuters) - Need a Kalashnikov in Belgium? No problem, says "Nemac" the Serb; a few hundred euros will buy the gun and a place to stash it in a car or truck coming up from the Balkans.

item.title: Britain's Labour Party battles for soul and identity
item.description: LONDON (Reuters) - In the 1970s, a trio of socialists joined a battle to steer Britain's Labour Party to the left. Within a few years, two of them had seized control of the council that governed London, running the capital for half a decade.

item.title: Gunmen kill four Egypt security personnel south of Cairo: sources
item.description: CAIRO (Reuters) - Gunmen killed four security personnel in an attack at a police checkpoint in Saqqara, near some of Egypt's historic pyramid sites, the Interior Ministry and three security sources said on Saturday.

item.title: Some guns used in Paris attacks produced in ex-Yugoslavia's arsenal
item.description: BELGRADE (Reuters) - Some assault rifles used by the Islamic militants in the Nov 13 Paris attacks and later seized in police raids were produced in the former Yugoslavia's state arsenal, the company's director said on Saturday.

item.title: North Korea tested submarine-launched missile, but launch failed: report
item.description: SEOUL (Reuters) - North Korea appeared to conduct a submarine-launched ballistic missile test on Saturday but it ended in failure with no indication that the missile successfully ejected from the vessel and took off, South Korea's Yonhap news agency reported.

item.title: Suicide bomber targets Afghan election official in Kabul: police
item.description: KABUL (Reuters) - A suicide bomber targeted a senior member of Afghanistan's election commission during the morning rush hour in the capital Kabul on Saturday, killing his driver and wounding several passersby.

item.title: Detained journalists urge EU not to compromise with Turkey over human rights
item.description: ANKARA (Reuters) - Two Turkish journalists arrested this week over their reports about arms supplies to Syria urged the European Union not to compromise on human rights and freedoms to reach an agreement with Turkey to help stem flows of migrants to Europe.

item.title: Europe needs U.S.-style bureau to tackle guns: experts
item.description: PARIS (Reuters) - If you're not a hunter or a target shooter, it's nearly impossible to buy a gun legally in France. But the country's strict gun control laws are not enough to keep deadly weapons out of the hands of Islamist militants.
